com.ora.ispspeedcheck.net
Class ISPDataLogger

java.lang.Object
  com.ora.ispspeedcheck.net.ISPDataLogger

public class ISPDataLogger
extends java.lang.Object

Light weight utility class to do some logging. There are more powerful logging options feel free to improve.

Author:
Milton Smith

println

public final void println(java.lang.String line)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Print a log entry to the CSV log file. Note: not process or thread safe. Also not optimized. We open, flush buffers, and close the file stream after every message is logged so you can CTRL-C or kill the process at anytime without corrupting file.

Parameters:
line - Message to log.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown on problems.

headerExists

public final boolean headerExists()
If the file exists we assume it has a CSV header.

Returns:
true, file and header exists. false, file does not exist.

getLogMessage

public final java.lang.String getLogMessage(java.lang.String server,
                                            int payloadbytes,
                                            int elapsed)
Create a log message suitable for logging to the CSV file.

Parameters:
server - Name of server file was downloaded from.
payloadbytes - Size of the payload in bytes.
elapsed - Elapsed time of the download in milliseconds.
Returns:
Formatted CSV log message.
